message.content:
cs.NI, cs.IT, cs.CR, cs.SY, cs.MM

This paper proposes a novel scheduling scheme for cellular vehicle-to-everything (C-V2X) networks, which are a type of wireless ad hoc network. The paper focuses on addressing the hidden-terminal problem, which is a well-known issue in wireless ad hoc networks. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). Additionally, the paper proposes a sensing-based semi-persistent scheduling (SPS) algorithm, which involves resource allocation and coordination among vehicles. This algorithm involves information theory and optimization, which are covered in cs.IT (Information Theory) and cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). The paper also evaluates the proposed scheme through simulations, which involves modeling and simulation, covered in cs.SY (Systems and Control) and cs.MM (Multimedia).
